data.title: Overview of criminal psychology
data.text: This chapter will introduce the definition of criminal psychology、History、Fundamental theories and their fields of study。

items.title: Definition of criminal psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology is the subject of research into criminal behaviour and its psychological mechanisms.，The aim is to understand the psychological characteristics and motives of the perpetrator.。

items.title: History of the development of criminal psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology is rooted in19The end of the century.，As psychology and jurisprudence develop, they become independent disciplines.。

items.title: Main areas of research
items.text: Including the psychological causes of crime.、Analysis of crime patterns、Criminal Psychological Assessment and Intervention, etc.。

items.title: Relations with other disciplines
items.text: Criminal psychology and law、Sociology、The subjects of biology are closely related.，Joint exploration of crime。

items.title: Biology
items.text: To explore genetics.、The effects of neurophysiology and other factors on criminal behaviour。

items.title: Psychological theory
items.text: Analysis of personality、Awareness、The link between emotional and other mental factors and criminal behaviour。

items.title: Sociological theory
items.text: Study of the social environment、Cultural background, etc., in shaping crime psychology。

items.title: Comprehensive theory
items.text: Combining biology.、Psychological and sociological perspectives，A full explanation of criminal psychology.。

data.title: The formation of a criminal mind
data.text: This chapter will look at individual factors.、Impact of environmental factors and psychological processes on the psychological aspects of crime。

items.title: Genetic factors
items.text: Research on the potential link between genes and criminal behaviour。

items.title: Psychopathic
items.text: To explore personality characteristics like offensiveness.、The relationship between motivation and crime。

items.title: Personal impairment
items.text: Analysis of the contribution of mental disorders, such as antisocial personality disorders, to criminal behaviour。

items.title: Early experience
items.text: Study of childhood trauma、Long-term impact of domestic violence, etc. on the psychological aspects of crime。

items.title: Family environment
items.text: Exploring family structures、The role of education in shaping crime psychology。

items.title: Social and environmental impacts
items.text: Analysis of peer pressure、Inducing crime in a community environment。

items.title: Economic factors
items.text: Research on poverty、Economic problems such as unemployment in relation to crime rates。

items.title: Cultural background
items.text: Exploring the impact of cultural values on crime psychology。

items.title: Cognitive process
items.text: Analysis of the offender's mind、Patterns of decision-making and their impact on behaviour。

items.title: Emotional processes
items.text: I'm talking about emotional adjustment.、The relationship between emotional loss and criminal behaviour。

items.title: Motivation of conduct
items.text: Studying the inner motives of the perpetrator，If interest-driven、Retaliation, etc.。

items.title: Decision-making mechanisms
items.text: Analysis of the decision-making process prior to the commission of a crime and its psychological mechanisms。

data.title: Types of crime and psychological characteristics
data.text: This chapter will analyse violent crime.、Psychological features of property crime and cybercrime。

items.title: The psychological characteristics of murder.
items.text: To explore the psychological motives of the murderer.，It's like an emotional conflict.、We're fighting for benefits and so on.。

items.title: Psychological characteristics of robbery
items.text: Analysis of the risk-taking mentality of robbers and reliance on violence。

items.title: Psychological characteristics of sexual offences
items.text: Study of psychological distortions and behavioural patterns of sex offenders。

items.title: Psychological characteristics of domestic violence
items.text: Exploring control and emotional deficiencies of perpetrators of domestic violence。

items.title: Psychological characteristics of theft
items.text: Analysis of the larceny and the desire for material.。

items.title: Psychological features of fraud
items.text: Exploring fraud techniques and psychological manipulation of fraudsters。

items.title: Psychological features of corruption
items.text: To study the corrupters' desire for power and moral degradation.。

items.title: Psychological features of money-laundering
items.text: Diagnosing the risk of a money launderer's psychological and legal circumvention strategy。

items.title: He's a hacker.
items.text: Exploring hackers ' technical worship and power challenges。

items.title: Psychological features of cyber-fraud
items.text: Analysis of cyber fraudsters ' ability to disguise and psychological manipulation techniques。

items.title: Psychological features of cyber-violence
items.text: Research on anonymous psychology and aggressiveness of cyber-violence abusers。

items.title: Internet addiction and crime
items.text: Exploring the dependence of Internet addicts on the virtual world and its links to crime。

data.title: Criminal psychological assessment and intervention
data.text: This chapter will present the methodology for the psychological assessment of crime and intervention strategies.，Exploring preventive measures。

items.title: Psychological tests
items.text: Assessment of the psychological state and personality characteristics of offenders through standardized testing。

items.title: Conduct Watch
items.text: Observing the routine behaviour of offenders，Analysis of patterns of behaviour and psychological motives。

items.title: Interview techniques
items.text: Understanding the psychological history of the perpetrator and the motives for the crime through in-depth interviews。

items.title: Case analysis
items.text: Analysis of the psychological characteristics and patterns of behaviour of offenders through typical cases。

items.title: Psychotherapy
items.text: Helping offenders to redress psychological problems through psychological counselling and treatment。

items.title: Behavioural corrections
items.text: Helping offenders to change bad behaviour patterns through behavioural training。

items.title: Social support
items.text: Social resource support，Helping offenders reintegrate into society。

items.title: Legal intervention
items.text: Legal regulation and punishment of criminal acts。

items.title: Early intervention
items.text: Prevention of behaviour of potential offenders through early psychological intervention。

items.title: Education prevention
items.text: Raising legal awareness and mental health through education。

items.title: Community prevention
items.text: Enhancing social cohesion through community activities，Reducing the causes of crime。

items.title: Policy prevention
items.text: Reducing social inequality through policy development，Reducing crime rates。

data.text: This chapter will address the issue of criminal psychology in criminal justice、Application in crime prevention and research education。

items.text: Use of psychological methods to improve the efficiency of interrogations，Get a real confession.。

items.text: Analysis of the jury ' s psychological process and its impact on the outcome of the judgement。

items.text: Helping persons in prison with psychological problems through psychotherapy，Reduce the rate of recidivism。

items.title: Community corrections
items.text: Reintegration of offenders through community support，Reducing the risk of recidivism。

items.title: Re-offending prevention
items.text: Reducing the likelihood of reoffending offenders through psychological assessment and intervention。
